title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 325-6.13 - Enforcement and appeals of decisions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 325-6.13 - Enforcement and appeals of decisions

State Regulations
(a) Any decisions of an arbitrator made
pursuant to the provisions of this Subpart may be enforced, vacated or modified
in accordance with the applicable provisions of sections
7509, 7510, 7511
and
7514
of the Civil Practice Law and Rules. No other provisions of article 75 of the Civil Practice Law and Rules, except
as may be otherwise provided in this Subpart, shall be applicable to
arbitration pursuant to this Subpart. The arbitrator, dispute forum and the
board shall not be made parties to a court proceeding relating to an
arbitration award. The participation of a party in such an arbitration
proceeding shall be a waiver of any claim against an arbitrator or the dispute
forum for any act or omission in connection with any arbitration conducted
under these rules. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
325-6.13

Adopted

New

York State Register April 6, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 14, eff. 6/1/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
